pullRequest.body:
In this PR, we define the type `M.Derivation œÜ` of derivations with values in a presheaf of `R`-modules `M` relative to
a morphism of `œÜ : S ‚ü∂ F.op ‚ãô R` of presheaves of commutative rings over categories `C` and `D` that are related by a functor `F : C ‚•§ D`. In the particular case `F` is the identity functor, we construct the universal derivation.

---

- [x] depends on: #14030


This is a refactor of #11570

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9664564335/job/26659493583)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9664564335/job/26659493284)
All the lean looks fine to me but I would like to be able to understand the module docstring better :-)
All the lean looks fine to me but I would like to be able to understand the module docstring better :-)

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion map (ùüô X) = (ModuleCat.restrictScalarsId' (R.map (ùüô X)) (R.map_id X)).inv.app (obj X) := by aesop ```
I'm still not fully convinced that our main API should built around a specific type of sheaf homs. Can't we just pullback `M` along `F` when necessary?
This is not a "specific type" of morphisms. This is *more general* than "any" `S ‚ü∂ R`.

But if you are developing material (e.g. `relativeDifferentials'`) for abstract `S ‚ü∂ R` below. I don't see how you can apply these back to morphisms of the form `S ‚ü∂ F.op ‚ãô R` (or $F^{-1}\mathcal{O}_S \to \mathcal{O}_R$) that allows use of this general API. In this sense, the material you are developing below is more restricted. 

I really believe that it would be cleaner if we can deal with pushforward-pullbacks separately later.

Another concern is, when you are viewing an abstract `(œÜ : S ‚ü∂ R)` as a `(œÜ : S ‚ü∂ (1 _).op ‚ãô R)`, it is abusing the underlying defeq of `(1 _)` and `op` etc, and I'm not sure how happy lean is with this when the `R` and `S` and the category are more complex.

Part of my point is that when we want to apply this to a morphism of schemes, then such a morphism is described as a morphism of topological spaces (which gives a certain functor `F` on categories of opens subsets) and a map `œÜ : Y.presheaf ‚ü∂ base _* X.presheaf` which fits precisely in the API I am suggesting. We could define $Omega^1$ by using the adjoint map `base ^* Y.(pre)sheaf ‚ü∂  X.(pre)sheaf`, but developing the API would be ackward because the pullback as a presheaf is not the same thing as the pullback as a sheaf.

The API you suggest is the *particular* case `Derivation'` in my PR. Using the more general API I suggest is a way to anticipate some issues when we want to sheafify.

We wouldn't need to sheafify the sheaf of rings though, so "pullback as a presheaf is not the same thing as the pullback as a sheaf" is a non-issue as we will work with the pullback sheaf all along.

Maybe I should first ask how you plan to get `relativeDifferentials` from `relativeDifferentials'`.

> Maybe I should first ask how you plan to get `relativeDifferentials` from `relativeDifferentials'`.

This is explained in the docstring of the file.
Aah okay fair enough.

Also, the equivalence of derivations for `S ‚ü∂ F.op ‚ãô R` and for `F^* S ‚ü∂ R` is of independent interest, and it can be stated only if the more general definitions are available (or if we had used absolute derivations).
Thanks for your understanding :-)
Can we use the newly introduced bundled derivation (in terms of `Module.Cat`) here?

With this degree of generality, we cannot use bundled derivations, but in the specific case of `Derivation'`, I will try to add a constructor which takes a family of bundled derivations, and a constructor for `IsUniversal` also.
We should also have `precomp`.
I would rather keep this for a separate PR.
I think it would be useful to get an `Subsingleton` instance on `d.Universal`.
Thanks for the suggestion. I shall add this.

Trying to read this first paragraph, I found myself not knowing what S was, and actually I'm still confused mathematically. If F : C => D then F.op >>> R is a presheaf of rings on D,and I'm guessing that S is a scheme because that's what it is in the next paragraph, and now I don't know what kind of object phi is supposed to be. Please feel free to add explanations so that I understand the first paragraph :-)

```suggestion
these definitions in the case where `F` is the pullback functor from
```

```suggestion
derivations for `S ‚ü∂ F.op ‚ãô R` identify with derivations
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: relative differentials as a presheaf of modules
